channel.title: What speakers do you use for your computer?
channel.description:
Well, heres my very complex system...
I have 2x 300Watt Bumper Subs connected to my stereo, which is connected to my computer by auxillery outputs... They put out some noise i'll tell you that...
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/k4ujxt.png[/img]

item.title: What speakers do you use for your computer?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:26, topic:334041”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=430433.msg3160890#msg3160890 date=1269540789]

Mine are like as loud as my 37" TV… and don’t sound tinny either because of the subwoofer.

We need pics + moar info of your new laptop bro!

@topic: I use my guitar amplifier(20W) as my computer speakers. I get epic bass from them but unfortunately it stuggles to produce higher pitched sounds.
[/quote]

Lool, my 30W amp sounds awful when I jack that up. :o
And, I got a Dell Studio 17, brand new a couple of weeks ago. :)[/quote]
Maybe Dell laptops generally have better in-built speakers. I was shocked at the quality of mine, and they were the most basic speakers of the most basic laptop on their website.

Read full topic

item.description:

JBL + subwoofer

Surely that sounds horrible :F

Nah man, they are the best quality speakers I have ever heard on a laptop.
[/quote]

Mine are like as loud as my 37" TV… and don’t sound tinny either because of the subwoofer.
